DataElement.preferredName: Clinical Events Domain Acute Graft Versus Host Disease Grade
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The agvhd toxicity grade using a standard toxicity scale (e.g., NCI CTCAE).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created as part of the CDISC mapping task_ghd_08.24.18

ValueDomain.preferredName: Acute Graft Versus Host Disease  Children's Oncology Group Maximum Grade
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the maximum grade or stage of severity of acute graft versus host disease as defined by the protocol of the Children's Oncology Group.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.: Invasive cancer confined to the original anatomic site of growth without lymph node involvement.: Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.: Cancer that has spread to distant anatomic sites beyond its original site of growth.: One, some, every, or all without specification.: A unique macroscopic (gross) anatomic structure that performs specific functions. It is composed of various tissues.  An organ is part of an anatomic system or a body region. Representative examples include the heart, lung, liver, spleen, and uterus.: Cancer confined to the epithelium without invasion of the basement membrane.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.
Invasive cancer confined to the original anatomic site of growth without lymph node involvement.
Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.
Cancer that has spread to distant anatomic sites beyond its original site of growth.
One, some, every, or all without specification.

A unique macroscopic (gross) anatomic structure that performs specific functions. It is composed of various tissues.  An organ is part of an anatomic system or a body region. Representative examples include the heart, lung, liver, spleen, and uterus.
Cancer confined to the epithelium without invasion of the basement membrane.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: I:  Stage 1-2 rash and no liver or gut Involvement

ValueMeaning.preferredName: I:  Stage 1-2 rash and no liver or gut Involvement
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition:
Invasive cancer confined to the original anatomic site of growth without lymph node involvement.
: Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.: Invasive cancer more extensive than stage I, usually involving local lymph nodes without spread to distant anatomic sites.: Any change in the skin which affects its appearance or texture. A rash may be localised to one part of the body, or affect all the skin. Rashes may cause the skin to change color, itch, become warm, bumpy, dry, cracked or blistered, swell and may be painful: The non-affirmative response to a question.: A triangular-shaped organ located under the diaphragm in the right hypochondrium. It is the largest internal organ of the body, weighting up to 2 kg. Metabolism and bile secretion are its main functions. It is composed of cells which have the ability to regenerate.: The upper gastrointestinal (GI) tract is comprised of mouth, pharynx, esophagus and stomach while the lower GI tract consists of intestines and anus. The primary function of the GI tract is to ingest, digest, absorb and ultimately excrete food stuff.: To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.: Invasive cancer confined to the original anatomic site of growth without lymph node involvement.

Concepts.definition: Invasive cancer confined to the original anatomic site of growth without lymph node involvement.
Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.
Invasive cancer more extensive than stage I, usually involving local lymph nodes without spread to distant anatomic sites.

Any change in the skin which affects its appearance or texture. A rash may be localized to one part of the body, or affect all the skin. Rashes may cause the skin to change color, itch, become warm, bumpy, dry, cracked or blistered, swell and may be painful.
The non-affirmative response to a question.

A triangular-shaped organ located under the diaphragm in the right hypochondrium. It is the largest internal organ of the body, weighting up to 2 kg. Metabolism and bile secretion are its main functions. It is composed of cells which have the ability to regenerate.

The upper gastrointestinal (GI) tract is comprised of mouth, pharynx, esophagus and stomach while the lower GI tract consists of intestines and anus. The primary function of the GI tract is to ingest, digest, absorb and ultimately excrete food stuff.
To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.
Invasive cancer confined to the original anatomic site of growth without lymph node involvement.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: II: Stage 3 rash, or Stage 1 liver Involvement or Stage 1 GI

ValueMeaning.preferredName: II: Stage 3 rash, or Stage 1 liver Involvement or Stage 1 GI
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition:
Locally advanced cancer that has spread to nearby organs but not to distant anatomic sites.: Any change in the skin which affects its appearance or texture. A rash may be localised to one part of the body, or affect all the skin. Rashes may cause the skin to change color, itch, become warm, bumpy, dry, cracked or blistered, swell and may be painful: Invasive cancer confined to the original anatomic site of growth without lymph node involvement.
: A triangular-shaped organ located under the diaphragm in the right hypochondrium. It is the largest internal organ of the body, weighting up to 2 kg. Metabolism and bile secretion are its main functions. It is composed of cells which have the ability to regenerate.: To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.: Pertaining to the stomach and intestines. : Invasive cancer more extensive than stage I, usually involving local lymph nodes without spread to distant anatomic sites.

Concepts.definition: Locally advanced cancer that has spread to nearby organs but not to distant anatomic sites.

Any change in the skin which affects its appearance or texture. A rash may be localized to one part of the body, or affect all the skin. Rashes may cause the skin to change color, itch, become warm, bumpy, dry, cracked or blistered, swell and may be painful.
Invasive cancer confined to the original anatomic site of growth without lymph node involvement.

A triangular-shaped organ located under the diaphragm in the right hypochondrium. It is the largest internal organ of the body, weighting up to 2 kg. Metabolism and bile secretion are its main functions. It is composed of cells which have the ability to regenerate.
To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.
Pertaining to the stomach and intestines.
Invasive cancer more extensive than stage I, usually involving local lymph nodes without spread to distant anatomic sites.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: IV: Stage 4 skin, liver or GI involvement

ValueMeaning.preferredName: IV: Stage 4 skin, liver or GI involvement
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An organ that constitutes the external surface of the body. It consists of the epidermis, dermis, and skin appendages.: A triangular-shaped organ located under the diaphragm in the right hypochondrium. It is the largest internal organ of the body, weighting up to 2 kg. Metabolism and bile secretion are its main functions. It is composed of cells which have the ability to regenerate.: Pertaining to the stomach and intestines. : To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.: Cancer that has spread to distant anatomic sites beyond its original site of growth.

Concepts.definition: An organ that constitutes the external surface of the body. It consists of the epidermis, dermis, and skin appendages.

A triangular-shaped organ located under the diaphragm in the right hypochondrium. It is the largest internal organ of the body, weighting up to 2 kg. Metabolism and bile secretion are its main functions. It is composed of cells which have the ability to regenerate.
Pertaining to the stomach and intestines.
To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.
Cancer that has spread to distant anatomic sites beyond its original site of growth.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: III: Stage 0-3 Skin, with Stage 2-3 liver, or Stage 2-3 GI

ValueMeaning.preferredName: III: Stage 0-3 Skin, with Stage 2-3 liver, or Stage 2-3 GI
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::0 - 3: An organ that constitutes the external surface of the body. It consists of the epidermis, dermis, and skin appendages.: Invasive cancer more extensive than stage I, usually involving local lymph nodes without spread to distant anatomic sites.: A triangular-shaped organ located under the diaphragm in the right hypochondrium. It is the largest internal organ of the body, weighting up to 2 kg. Metabolism and bile secretion are its main functions. It is composed of cells which have the ability to regenerate.: Pertaining to the stomach and intestines. : Locally advanced cancer that has spread to nearby organs but not to distant anatomic sites.

Concepts.definition: The extent of a cancer in the body.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
An organ that constitutes the external surface of the body. It consists of the epidermis, dermis, and skin appendages.
Invasive cancer more extensive than stage I, usually involving local lymph nodes without spread to distant anatomic sites.

A triangular-shaped organ located under the diaphragm in the right hypochondrium. It is the largest internal organ of the body, weighting up to 2 kg. Metabolism and bile secretion are its main functions. It is composed of cells which have the ability to regenerate.
Pertaining to the stomach and intestines.
Locally advanced cancer that has spread to nearby organs but not to distant anatomic sites.
